definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: That's such a beautiful dress. I'm tempted to use some of my mad money and buy it.
sentences.chinese: 那件衣服太漂亮了，我真想用一些私房钱买下它。

sentences.english: But all in a word, I firmly oppose saving cash dough.
sentences.chinese: 总之，我坚决反对存私房钱。

sentences.english: Later that month she used her play money to buy a piece of bumble gum.
sentences.chinese: 后来她用私房钱账户里的钱买了一块口香糖。

sentences.english: "Mad Money" great harm, must not be allowed to spread.
sentences.chinese: “私房钱”危害很大，绝不能任其滋生蔓延。

sentences.english: I save some egg money for the newest-PSP.
sentences.chinese: 我想买最新的游戏机，所以存了点私房钱。

sentences.english: My wife and I each receive our own play money, and here’s the best part.
sentences.chinese: 太太和我都有自己的私房钱，这一点最好了。

sentences.english: Two people come up with their own money donated a hope primary school.
sentences.chinese: 两人拿出自己的私房钱捐助了一所希望小学。

sentences.english: Maybe he will give you some surprise with his egg money.
sentences.chinese: 也许有天他会用私房钱给你个惊喜呢。

sentences.english: My father sometimes squirrels some money away before he gives his salary to my mom.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸有时会在将薪水交给我妈妈之前偷藏私房钱。

definition: supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
private saved money of close family members
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
